data.title: John Tharp Sr. (1711-abt.1764)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for John Tharp Sr. born 1711 Tuckahoe Hundred, Talbot County, Province of Maryland died 1764 Mispillion Hundred, Kent upon Delaware including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + Y-chromosome DNA + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 23 May 2023 | Created 7 Sep 2011

This page has been accessed 1,570 times.

Biography

John Tharp (Sr.) was born in Tuckahoe Hundred, Talbot Co., Province of Maryland of William Tharp and Jane Austin. He married Elizabeth Jordan. Abt 1750 they migrated to Murderkill Hundred, Kent Co., on the Delaware {River} where he had been granted 180 acres of land. (John, along with his brother William, had sold their land in Talbot Co, Maryland in 1750). John and William were on the Murderkill Tax List in 1751. John then moved to Mispillion Hundred, Kent upon Delaware in 1756 as shown by the Tax List. [1]

Some researchers find his last Tax list mention in 1764 in Mispillion Hd., Kent upon Delaware and give 1764 as his death date but it is likely that he is the John Tharp (Sr.) in the Baltimore Hd., Sussex Co. Delaware 1782 Tax List, [2]

John remarried to a Mary Unknown probably in Baltimore Hd., Sussex Co. Delaware as she is the adminx. of his Sussex Co. Will and was living near daughter Ruth who had married Benjamin Long of that place.

John Tharp's Inferred death place was Delaware as his probate was in Sussex, Delaware; administration of estate was assigned to Mary Tharp July 4, 1790. (Note: this must be estate of John Sr. because his son John (b1756) married Leah Morris, and relocated to North Carolina, then Indiana.) [3]

The Wikipedia account of the William Tharp who became a governor of Delaware confirms this relocation: "Tharp was born in Farmington, Delaware, the son of James and Eunice Fleming Tharp. His great grandfather had settled near Frankford, Delaware in 1735." except the year is suspect. [4]

Sources

↑ Rootsweb, Gary Tharp, "Tharp and Related Families"

↑ 1782 Assessment and Census Lists, Delaware, compiled by Ralph Nelson, et al., Delaware Genealogical Society, 1994, 2nd ed., 2002 (CD)

↑ Delaware, Wills and Probate Records, 1676-1971, Will Abstracts, Vol 1. online at Ancestry.com

↑ William Tharp on Wikipedia

See Also:

VVDM-ZJ Ancestral File Number at FamilySearch.org

[Occupation: Planter]

Kent Co Deed Book Q, p. 23

Acknowledgments

Thanks to John Long for starting this profile; adopted by Marj Adams

WikiTree profile Tharp-137 created through the import of O'Bryan Family tree.ged on Sep 6, 2011 by Tim Tropeck.

Maner L. Thorp provided extensive documentation in his Tharp PDF that is too large to upload to Wikitree in its entirety, but an excerpt about John is included here.

p333, Aug 7, 1750. William and John Thorpe acknowledged their deed to John Plummer Sr. before Perry Benson and Thomas Porter.

p334, Aug 7, 1750. William and John Thorpe to John Plummer Sr--Receipt of 6000 pounds of tobacco in full. Wit: Thomas Porter

*https://www.ancestry.co.uk/boards/thread.aspx?mv=flat&m=596&p=surnames.tharp-info from:shineon129 Port Jervis, New York, USA
